metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1283 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the XML_GetBuffer function in Expat through 2.1.0, as used in Google Chrome before 44.0.2403.89 and other products, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted XML data, a related issue to CVE-2015-2716. USN-2726-1 addressed CVE-2015-1283 for Expat. This update provides the corresponding fix for VNC4 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-browser-l10n - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-chromedriver - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
No subscription required

expat - 2.1.0-7
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7
No subscription required

libxmltok1 - 1.2-4ubuntu0.22.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ccdm94> cmake 3.20.5 and forward uses expat 2.2.10+.

criterions.comment: cadaver package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
chromium-browser package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195').
coin3 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
expat package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7').
libxmltok package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2-4ubuntu0.22.04.1~esm1').
matanza package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
swish-e package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
xmlrpc-c package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
